intro: Bassovia trizyga, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for. The plant is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
